I was debating between 3 and 4 stars.  Overall I liked my sandwich ( I had the Pan Con Chicharron) which is described as sliced pork loin, fried yams, and marinated onions.
The sandwich was good sized and the bread was yummy.  The meat seemed to be in chunks more so than sliced and sadly the meat didn't really have any flavor.  I'd like to go back and try more of their entrees and who knows maybe I just got one bum sandiwch. 
It was a good value andn overall decent just wish the flavor was kicked up a notch or two.
author: Danielle F.

description:
The best "Pan con Chicharrón" I ever ate !
Pan con Chicharrón is a peruvian classic, and we traditionally have it for breakfast, although I would not do that with a sanguchón because I might wanna just go back to bed...When I found out about this truck I started following them, somehow during my visits to SF we never seem to cross paths  and when we moved to the Bay Area I was definitelly gonna find them. First time they were in Alameda on a rainy day and we made the trip down there, high expectations were met. The sandwich is huge (in Peru we'd call it sanguchón) Lots of tender and crispy in the outside pork meat, perfect onions, delicious aioli and my favorite part is the jams, that sweetness is the perfect compliment. My husband who is american and had tried several good lomo saltados in Peru and here had teh pan con lomo saltado and he loves it. The second time we were on our way from Santa Barbara and they happened to be in Hayward..how convenient for us! it was on the way home and we were hungry. I was not dissapointed, same big great, delicious sanguchón. I can't wait to have my fix every time they come up to Off the Grid in Lake Merrit, starting today =)
author: Ca N.

description: This food truck is excellent. Happily stumbled upon Sanguchon at Off the Grid in Concord shortly after checking into the Hilton. Ordered the Lomo Saltado sandwich combo with sweet potato fries, both of which were perfectly prepared and delicious. I'm looking forward to finding this truck around the Bay Area in the future and trying the rest of their menu!
author: Samuel C.

description:
These are some solid sandwiches - definitely a fan.

Barbaccoa - pulled pork sandwich, the sauce and the slaw is really yummy.  The first time I had it the pork was tender, but the second time it was a bit dry and chewy.  The sauce definitely saved the sandwich.

Lomo Saltado - the beef sandwich, caution there are a TON of onions.  The beef was really good though and they stick fries in the sandwich which is pretty awesome.

Dulce de Leche cookies - massive shortbread cookies with dulce de leche sandwiched in the middle.  These were ok, but not to die for...they sounded a lot better than they came out to be.

I look forward to trying the other items on the menu.  Yum!
author: Doris L.

description:
The Loma Saltado (stir fried New York steak, tomato, onion, cilantro, soy sauce and fries) is one of THE BEST sandwiches I have ever eaten! 

The meat is lean and perfectly cooked and it's even easy to eat! (Who wants a soggy sandwich where the guts fall out and your stuck with two mushy slices of bread and a pile of mess!!??)

Delish! Go eat one!
author: Tiffany G.

description: A colleague of mines asked my to leave my brown bag and try out the Peruvian Food Truck across the way.  Not only was I treated to some fresh air and some sunshine, but to my surprise, a delicious grilled sandwich $8.  I tried the Lomo Saltado grilled steak sandwich and it was awesome.  The meat was grilled to perfection and just thinking of the sandwich makes me yearn to go back again next time they are here!
author: B P.

description: This review is based only on the "pan con chicharon " because I only tried that today at the Pleasanton area. I didn't like it at all. Also doesn't look anything like their picture. I have tried it before in other places , They need to really work on this more.
author: P V.

description: OMG I ordered the Lomo Saltado sandwich and it was honestly phenomenal! I just wished they had the food truck permanently in one place because I always need to track it down on their website...yeah, it was that good!
author: Sanjeev T.

description:
Moving out of the Potrero area and finding out this GEM towards my last weeks I was working in that area makes me really sad.

It's definitely THE place to go when it's related to street food. The quality of the dishes they give you are A++ and the flavors of them are what they should be! (HELLO! I'm peruvian and grew up with that food)  and to be honest is hard to find a peruvian place in the city that has that taste, and the items that i tried there ... they were spot on!

Aji de Gallina has always been MY favorite dish, and the way these guys make it is totally spot on!

Check out their daily specials - you'll be surprised by the goodies they offer there (and sometimes you won't find that in a regular peruvian restaurant in the bayarea)
author: JD G.

description: I go out of my way to find this truck when it is parked in SF. I always get the lomo saltado, steak and fries sandwich on a toasted bun with sauteed onions and some sort of magical sauce. The best food truck cuisine I've ever experienced - fast, delicious, and high quality ingredients.
author: Shoshana L.

description:
Had the Sanguchon truck recently on the peninsula and was disappointed in the food.  I ordered the Chicharron and Lomo Saltado with sweet potato fries.  Both of the sandwiches were bland and very dry.  It felt like they needed some sauce or something to make it more moist and tasty.  I think there were other things in the sandwich, like fries, but it was just all way too dry.  The bread to meat ratio was off- the bread was way too big and thick for the amount of meat.  Maybe I ordered the wrong things, but the guy said the Lomo Saltado was the most popular sandwich.  
Service was good, friendly and relatively fast.

Go again?  Unfortunately no, I don't think I'd go again.
author: J L.

description: The steak sandwich was a sexual experience for me. I'll spare you the details but THANK YOU.
author: Aaron H.

description: My standard order is the lomo saltado and the plantains and they are damn good. I'd really like to try something else on their menu. Really would. Can't do it. Always go back for the lomo saltado and platanos.
author: Susan S.

description:
Decided to give Sangucheria my lunch money today, despite previous top-notch experiences with the other Off The Grid trucks parked nearby at St. Mary's Square.  I was actually headed towards Senor Sisig (yum) until I saw the word Peruvian adjacent to the Pig-On-Fire logo.  What more does one need to know?

I got the Pan con Chicharron (pig on fire!) and thought it was a really nice combination of flavors.  The piglet was tender, with just a little char around the edges, and the fried yam adds enough sweet to offset the citrusy and vinegary of the aji aioli and marinated onions (which could have been overpowering were they not applied in harmonious proportions). The bun was juuuuust right, though perhaps a bit small to hold all the great big chunks of pure porky goodness. 

$8 is typical for San Fran food truck fare, though I've definitely gotten less for my money at other trucks, so I recommend checking these guys out.  I'll definitely be back next week to try the Saltado (cow on fire!)
author: tom V.

description: I can only speak for the lomo saltado - I LOVE these sandwiches!  It's hard for me to see this truck and resist ordering THE sandwich.  New york steak, onion, tomatoes, fries, soy sauce, and yummy bread.  Fries?!?  Yes!  Move over california burrito, I have a new favorite.  $8 for something that looks a little small, but surprisingly filling.  Will I try something else so I can give a more comprehensive review for this truck?  Nope.  I'm completely happy with their lomo saltado.
author: K P.

description: My wife just hired Sanguchon food truck to come to my 50th birthday party. The guests RAVED about the food! With 125 people to serve, it was easy and delicious! And the staff on the truck were great guys. I highly recommend.
author: Brian S.

description:
Before I begin my review, let me correct my rating: 3.5 stars

I was attracted to this truck because I never had Peruvian food before and there was a pig on the truck.  Something new to eat and pork is always a good combo.

I ordered the Pan Con Chicharron which I enjoyed.  This sandwich contained a generous amount of tender pork, yams (which I didn't know was in there until I opened it up), red onions which added texture to each bite (make sure to have a mint right after), and an aioli sauce to add another level of flavor.  

The staff is really friendly and there were only a few people in line which definitely were pluses.  The negative was paying $4 for an order of yucca fries.  The order only contained like 6 fries.  What what?!?!  I could not enjoy the fries since I was trying to overcome the price...haha

Anyways, good grub and I would definitely go back to try their other pork products.
author: Suzi K.

description:
Fly to Peru. Or just walk here.

The owner of two incredible Peruvian restaurants in the city (Mochica: http://www.yelp.com/biz/mochica-san-francisco#hrid:Vld3zcJ8hK69U1xQO4UjXA and Piqueo's http://www.yelp.com/biz/piqueos-san-francisco#hrid:5zvzH1BVAIBf_PEegC3QFA) has taken to the streets. Does his craft translate to a food truck? Almost.

The Pollo a la Brasa. Roasted chicken. Tomato. Lettuce. Some mayo based salsa they left out upon request. House baked bread. Sounded perfect.

Good yes. Perfect no. Chicken is a mix of white and dark meat which is to be expected but not my thing. $8 was reasonable but not a steal. Overall no better or worse than many other sandwich spots around town.

Still worth a visit if only to say you've had Peruvian street food for lunch. No flying needed.
author: Jason B.

description: I must say this is my favorite food truck. The staff is very friendly and they are very fast at getting the orders out. I always recommend it to all my friends the Lomo saltado and platanos are to die for.
author: Veronica N.

description:
Thank you , very considerate of you .

I could see by the quality of the pork meat and the bread , that it was made with good quality products . As I mentioned above , it tasted good. I am a foodie and cook myself . I appreciate the care you put in your preparation .

It is just too bad mine gave me that reaction.
I am honestly a little scared , but I may venture again .
author: Tam T.

description: Just got a chicharron sandwich here (not to be confused with the Mexican fried pork rinds) with sweet potato fries. It's a combo for $10. Plus an Inca Kola - $12 total. The food is terrific. I loved that the pork had no fat in it whatsoever. Can't wait to try the Lomo Saltado next. We had a big group, so we probably waited about 15 - 20 minutes for our food, but it was worth the wait.
author: Lizzy R.

description: Delicious, rich Lomo Saltado sandwich with sweet potatoe fries.  Food was a little on the expensive side for a food truck sandwich but was delicious.  The sweet potatoe fries were a great accompaniment to the food.  Only complaint was that the sandwich was a little dry.  If they had a little more sauce or cooked the meat a little less it would have been perfect.
author: Cody P.

description: Lomo Saltado sandwich was great! The meat was tender and flavorful and the spices used were tasty. The bun was nice and fresh! I will be back fo sho!
author: Michael W.

description:
delish. i'd recommend their lomo saltado for a great steak sandwich or pan con chicharron for a bit of gluttonous fatty pork loin which is balanced well with the sweet potato and pickled onion they have in there to cut through the fat. 

at this point, i've had too many pulled pork sandwiches from food trucks and theirs didn't necessarily stand out to me.
author: Megan H.

description:
I asked them to put the lomo saltado in a wrap, add rice & lettuce & hot sauce (aji amarillo, didn't have a lot of flavor but had a very pleasant burn that I loved) and I devoured my wrap.  Pretty sure everyone else around me was jealous.  The lomo saltado, if you're unfamiliar, is beef strips stir fried with tomatoes, onions, tomatoes, and fries.  I've had bad lomo saltado and good lomo saltado - theirs is good.  If they offered lomo saltado bowls, I'd definitely get them.  (HINT HINT NUDGE NUDGE)

I need to go back a few more times to try the other items but so far, so so very good.  I am salivating as I write this review just thinking about it.
author: Justine L.

description: I tried the Lomo Saltado which is Stir fried New York steak with tomato, onion, cilantro soy sauce & fries. It was interest. The fries could have been on the side of the sandwich instead of in the sandwich. In which I thought was weird. The flavor was very different. I never had Peruvian food before so I didn't know what I expect. The New York steak was ok but it could have been better.
author: Ashley G.

description:
I've been to this truck twice so far, and the sandwiches have been fabulous.

Pan con chicharron - Yeah... it's phenomenal.  Just look at the other reviews.

Barbacoa - Pulled BBQ pork with cole slaw and potato chips on a soft bioche bun.  I didn't really taste/feel the chips, but I thought it was fantastic.  I loved the sauce, and kept trying to soak up the drippings back into the bun.  This probably made the sandwich fell apart towards the end, but I was happy to get my fingers dirty and lick them clean.

The sandwiches were definitely large enough for lunch.  I ordered the yucca fries the first time, but I don't think I'll get them again.  There weren't many "fries" and I don't think it's worth $4.  If I'm really hungry, I'll try some of the other sides, but the sandwich alone is enough to keep my belly very happy.
author: Todd K.

description: OMG okay I kept seeing this truck by my job on Mission in the Financial District but I did not know what to order as I did not know who to get an opinion from then here comes along a co-worker who order a sandwich and it looked so good but I opted for another truck boy was I sorry he said his sandwich was so darn good with an egg on it & sat in front of me eating and made it look so delicious so I said I am getting that next time.......soooooooo I did & let me tell you I opted for the "Pan con Chicarron" it was so good I wanted more and more and more and I only ate half as I shared with a coworker. The bun was ever so slightly toasted the meat was so tender and the sweet potato fries were to die for not to mention the sauce I got to put on it, we both took one bite and looked at each other and did not say a word it was talking with our eyes and smiling from ear to ear OMG I can't wait every week for that truck to be there around the corner by WFB it takes my breath away. "Yummo" I love that sandwich I can honestly say I now have an addiction a tasty one "Pan con Chicarron" oh yeah baby...Thank you
author: Vivian H.

description: Yummy lunch option. Very accommodating people, delicious food, and fast! For about $8-10, you can't go wrong here. Oh, get the yam fries. So good!
author: Jess T.

description:
I never liked the idea of eating at Food  Trucks until I find out there was a Peruvian one and I felt curious to try. I love Peruvian food. Now I'm obsessed.

The lomo saltado sandwich is my favorite ever!!!!!! the pork sandwich is to die for. And for dessert nothing better than cookies con dulce de leche "alfajores" 

Triple Yum!
author: jorge k.

description:
The food here is TERRIBLE and expensive!  Definitely NOT worth it!  Two thumbs DOWN!  If I could give a negative star rating I would!

I heard about this food truck for awhile before I finally had the opportunity to try it.  I talked with a couple of people who tried it and liked it, I read the online reviews......and from what I was hearing, this is one of those trucks with some amazing food!  From a few of the reviews, it sounded like you had no idea what good food was until you tried this truck!  Boy what a let down!!  Either that, there must be some other secret Sanguchon truck that everyone else is eating at because I can't figure out what the hype is!!  

I went there with a friend and I paid for the both of us.  I ordered two $9 Barbacoa sandwiches and two cans of Inca Cola and the total came to $24.  Hmmm......$24 for two sandwiches and two cans of soda??  Oh well, no worries I thought.....it would all be worth it after I got to finally taste this "to die for" food!  I don't mind paying a premium when you get food that's really good.  When I finally got our order, it turned out there was a serving of sweet potato fries with the order in which I was charged for.  I didn't order those!  My friend said that he didn't hear me order those either.  No worries, I am still anxious to try this amazing food so I didn't say anything about the order mistake.  I take my first bite and WTF!!??  This sandwich tastes like those tubs of BBQ beef mixed in BBQ sauce that you buy in the refrigerated section of the grocery store!!!  I paid $9 for this cr@p!!???  The bread was fresh and slightly toasted, but that was about the best part of the whole sandwich.  I then tried the small order of sweet potato fries which I didn't order and cost me $4.....they were okay at best, but definitely nothing to rave about.

After leaving, I couldn't help but feel ripped off!  There are frozen dinners that I've enjoyed more than this!!  I honestly never felt so ripped off from a restaurant vendor before!!  I still feel a bit irritated about this and it's been 3 weeks since I ate there.  I held off, but I finally felt I had to write this review!  I don't know where the "Peruvian" part comes into this BBQ sauce sandwich, but this is NOT Peruvian food!!  I don't know wtf it is!!  Maybe a "wanna be" McRib sandwich with BBQ sauce and pork meat??  I would have rather bought $24 worth of McRib sandwiches vs these Barbacoa ones.  I've been to Peru before, enjoyed the food there, and I also have Peruvian friends that make authentic dishes.  From the food that I tried at Sanguchon, this has nothing to do with Peru!  

Granted, I haven't tried everything on their menu, but since this first time has left a bad taste in my mouth (literally), I am not in the least tempted to waste more time and money to even try anything else from here!!  I'm off to McDonald's to get a Big Mac instead!
author: Alex B.

description: We got this at Off the Grid McCoppin Hub. The Barbacoa Sandwich had a generous portion on meat, though it was way too sweet. They could have dialed back the BBQ sauce and it would have been better. The alfajores come in packs of two and are supposedly home made - nothing special here. They had empanadas as the special appetizer that day. They came out mushy and limp - total disappointment. Stick to El Porteno for your empanadas. Lastly, the chicha morada drink tasted like they had added artificial sweetener; totally gross. 2.5 stars rounded up to 3.
author: Andrew C.

description: Bread was stale. Tasted like they toasted it earlier in the day instead of made to order. Pork was dry and flavorless and to top it all off they charged me twice and didn't return my calls about it. Horrible place and I can't believe I was generous and gave them a $2 tip. I want my money and tip back.
author: Paul S.

description: I got the chicharron sandwich with the yucca fries. The bread was good but the meat inside the sandwich lacked the juicyness and taste that I expected from all the reviews. I don't know, the meat had little flavor. The yucca fries were really good though!
author: Jennifer J.

description: A delicious sandwich, on perfectly crunchy bread, with fried plantains. What more could you ask for?
author: Matthew L.

description:
I tried this food truck at Moveable Feast last week.

The sweet potato fries were excellent!  I was really looking forward to the lomo soltado sandwich, but it was nothing special.
author: Amy H.

description: Is the Lomo Saltado the best thing I have ever eaten in my entire life? Why yes.. yes it is!
author: Kevin H.

description:
Lomo Saltado was seasoned well and the bread tasted fresh. It was topped with fries which I've always done with my hamburgers but have never seen as part of a menu. 

Knocked a star down for the girl ringing people up. She was rude to the people ahead of me, and was pretty snooty to me too.
author: Matthew T.

description: Got the BBQ Pork sandwich, it was huge and really tastey.  Great deal and reakky tastey, definitely would get it again.  The cheese filled wonton side was pretty bland and heavy, wish i got the yucca fries
author: j s.

description: Tried the sandwich with grilled hot link, egg and plantains. I like how the sweetness of the plantains balances out the saltiness of the hot link. But it's still a heavy meal.
author: Cindy H.

description:
I too spotted the truck outside City College after exercising my Peruvian voting rights. 

I loved the look of the truck, it was packed and after waiting and seeing the sandwiches that were served, i wasn't so lucky; they were sold out.  I got to try the yuccas and the tamales, my daughter enjoyed every single yucca while my nephew and I had the tamales (we got three instead of two since they ran out of yuccas too).  

We also ordered the Alfajores (a delectable powdered sugar cookie filled with dulce de leche) The Alfajor was the best I've ever had!   La mar restaurant in San Francisco recently featured an Alfajor dessert and it did not compared to El Sanguchon's food truck!  The ratio of dulce de leche to the cookie was what I considered greatness!  I had to scramble to get more cash out of my purse (all of my parking quarters) so I can buy some more and bring them home to my husband to try.  Being american and loving chocolate, Alfajores typically don't impressed him, but this one did, so much that he wants me to call and order more! 

I was so impressed with Sanguchon, I just wished they had not run out of sandwiches so I could try one.  But let me tell you this, they looked awesome, their bread selection was a great choice!
author: Corey B.

description:
Hey vegetarians!

I was nervous about eating from a truck with a pig on the side too. However, I must say that curried vegetable wrap is really quite tasty and definitely worth trying.

The sweet potato fries are pretty ridiculously good too. (They are sprinkled lightly with cheese for some reason.)
author: R L.

description: OMG! I had a bite of their sandwich...nothing I ever had before and mmmmm mmmm!  Anouther guy next to me took a bite and mustve thanked god.  But yea best thing Ive had in a while!
author: Francisco M.

description: Buenisimo!!!! Wow...thanks for qwelcoming me to my new home in Alameda. After spending hours and hours moving furniture, the chicharron sandwhich and fried plantains hit the spot. And the meat was not fatty or greasy....nor were the plantains..I think they were the best maduros I have ever eaten with the cream and.cheese omg...that will definitely be a Sat spot in Alameda. Muy bien hecho....thank you.
author: Rebecca B.

description: 4 stars for the yuca fries and the chicken moni (chicken wrap).  The passion fruit drink was also good.
author: R And J.

description: There are plenty of fancy Peruvian restaurants in the Bay. All are great. But how often do you get true Peruvian food out of a gourmet food truck? Sanguchon is definitely worth it. They were nice enough to let me get half lomo saltado and half barbacoa. Stick with the Peruvian staple skirt steak with fries though: lomo saltado. The barbacoa is a bit dry and lacked flavor. The lomo was excellent. I've had it at a few restaurants, and put into a sandwich, it's definitely good. The sandwich size it small, but it packs a punch so one will do. I'll be back for more lomo.
author: Chuck N.

description:
man, this sandwich is money! mint! clutch! legit!

I've had the pan con chicharron several times now, and I'm happy for the addition to my short list of options for lunch around work. At $8 I'm content, (tho wish it were slightly cheaper) and I keep coming back. It's a sandwich about the size of a burger, and I'm stuffed after taking it down. There's fatty pork, fried yams, pickled onions, and this great white aioli in it and it never fails to satisfy. I've also had their lomo saltado sandwich (steak with tomato, onion, and fries) which was also good, but not as good as the pan con chicharron in my opinion. 

Solid lunch option.
author: Christine L.

description: Their lomo saltado sandwich is amazing!  My first thought was, "Why does everything have to be made into a sandwich?"  BUT I was pleasantly surprised by the deliciousness of the whole combination.  Tender steak + french fries + stir-fried onions & tomatoes + amazing bun + special sauce = awesome sandwich.  And for $8, you are getting a lot of food.  Haven't tried the yucca fries yet, but I'm excited to try them next time!
author: Liz H.

description: The Tequenos are so bomb. They are little fried wontons wraps with cheese, tiny pieces of ham, served with avocado puree and drizzled with honey. The balance of sweet and salty is perfection. Although I vary my main entre from food truck to food truck, I always get the Tequenos as my side.
author: Daniel K.

description: I had a treat today- my company arranged to have the Sanguchon food truck come to our work. it was da bomb!  I had the Pan Con Chicharron (pork sandwich) and platano fritos. what a combo!! absolutely delicious. Sue, one of the gals inside the truck, and I got to talking about Peruvian food and it turns out they have three restaurants in bay area: Mochica, Piqueos, and La Costanera. gonna make an effort to hit them all! good eats! thanks sue!
author: Steven D.

description: I would love to tell you about the Pan con chicharron sandwich that I had but it was so bland and unremarkable that I don't really recall any other details. The side order of yucca fries completed the blandfest. Thanks Sanguchon for such an unremarkable lunch.
author: Kris S.

description: Good food, bad service brothers, I had a Lomo Saltado Sandwich from the Sanguchon Truck parked by AT&T Park for the Giants Fan Fest on 2/9/13. The sandwich tasted good (and was juicy) but I felt it was small for the $ that you pay. I also asked for the Yuca fries but they ran out of it. My friend ordered the Fried Bananas(Platanos) & did not care for the yellow Mexican chilli sauce on top of it. I think the cashier and cooks need to learn how to speak English as it would help them in communicating with customers. I'm Peruvian-American and I can vouch for the authentic Peruvian food taste. Overall it was a pretty good experience but it could have been better as it was a little expensive and felt like a waste of $.
author: Eddie V.

description:
This is a Peruvian sandwich truck on 17th and Carolina by the park. I must say my first experience was a disaster - I was really thinking about ripping them a new one. But I decided to give them a second and third try. 

I've tried their steak and chicken sandwiches and they are good.The meat was flavorful but they need to add more meat in the steak sandwiches. The steak sandwiches have fries in the them. Yum - O!

The chicken is okay but there may be some tendons in there. 

Also, they need to work faster. They are pretty slow and the first time we waited over 30 minutes because they ran out of meat, then asked us to order something else, ran out of that again and then delivered orders for 10 people ahead of us. Not good. They then blamed the frier for making us wait.

They have potential but need to work out the kinks.
author: Brian W.

description: Amazing Lomo Saldato (stir fried marinated NY steak with onions, tomatoes, lettuce and fries on a toasted bun)!!!  It was meaty and tasty!  Will be back when this food truck returns.  Well worth the $8 for its size and taste!
author: Mary Ann M.

description: Had the pleasure of trying this truck at the North Berkeley Off the Grid dinner and fell in love with the Pan con Chicharron.  Oh my gods, so good.  Just thinking about it makes me hungry.  The bread was ridiculously good, the yams made such a good spread, and the chicharron had the lovely crispy bits which make a good chicharron SO GOOD.  The only thing that would improve this sandwich is more aioli spread on, but hey, I can ask for extra right?
author: Lauren S.

description: They were great, the pan con chicahron..awesome the yuca seemed frozen but fuck it, they were great and gave my kid a free juice pork is great and they rock the shit
author: Stanley D.

description: Their lomo saltado is hella delicious. i look forward to eating there whenever they are in my neck of woods.  Totally worth it.
author: Emmy B.

description:
Im giving them a 1 star review for my experience with their Brisbane truck. I couldnt find a Yelp listing for their Brisbane truck... hence writing it here.

The attitude of the guy who took the order was pretty callous. He wanted to charge me a dollar more for the veggie wrap than what was stated on the menu. Eventually he agreed not to charge me an extra dollar. 

Next problem - when my order arrived and I took it back to my cube and started eating the veggie wrap, I got a piece of Chicken in my mouth. They got my order wrong.

Overall bad experience. i could be one of those who got bad service, but am defintely not going back here again.

Although I have to say when I went back to complain - the guy did say sorry and returned my money.
author: A K.

description: Peruvians got it right with the sammy!  Only complaint I got for this truck is they sell out fast!   I tried a few of the dishes, the NY steak and pulled pork, both very good, and both very unique taste.  I recommend their sweet potato fries but the yucca fries wasn't for me.
author: Grant L.

description: Saw this truck in San Jose (Saratoga Ave) during a Saturday food truck meet. I enjoy Peruvian food, so this was a no brainer. We got the pollo a la brasa and it was good - big, hearty and limey! We also got fried plantains which was sweet and delicious. This was like food and dessert in one. This is no Limon Rotisserie (SF), but it's doable.
author: Cindy T.

description: The criollo (chicken) sandwich is [cuss]ing delicious!!! They give you a fork for a good reason...
author: Maximillian M.

description: food was kind of cold, i didn't like the french fries in the lomo sandwich just because they use  frozen french fries. Pan con chicharron was ok but a LOT of fat.  I also try the tequenos but i didn't like the honey on top, better without it. Maracuya (passion fruit) wasn't  good either
author: Miriam G.

description: Loma Saltado! Taste so good like homemade. Best steak sandwich in San Jose when Sanguchon truck comes to town. Wish they could get down to the South Bay more often. We have a few places in South bay that specialize in steak sandwiches, too bad they all suck. Please open shop down here :-) Of coarse highly recommended.
author: Gino V.

description:
At my job we'd all been anxiously waiting for this food truck to arrive in Potrero Hill to diversify our lunch menu options, and we were not disappointed. I ate there for the first time today and it was mind-blowingly delicious. Every other bite my coworker and I found ourselves saying "wow!" "this is SO good" and "oh yum"!

 It was the perfect sized lunch, and at $7 a wrap the price is right too. I'll definitely be back! I'm only hoping we get Sanguchon in the hood as long as possible (preferably in their current location next to the park)- it seems a lot of food trucks start out here, then move to SOMA as they get bigger (like Chairman Bao).Stay around, Sanguchon! We love you!
author: Light E.

description:
AMAZING. This truck comes to my work on Fridays occasionally and I always look forward to it. The Loma sandwhich is amazing and I had the chicken wrap for the first time today that I scarfed down so quickly because it was delicious! The guy taking orders, Jose, was such a doll and made my day with his wonderful attitude and spirit! He also had great hair! 
Cannot wait for this truck to come back :) Yum YUM!
author: Luci B.

description: They came by work at EA and I got a chance to try it - the ceviche was fantastic, some of the best I've ever had. Yucca fries were fine but I didn't like the consistency as much as potato fries. I'd definitely go again given the opportunity.
author: Michael L.

description: We had one of their pork sandwiches and it was OK.  The Yucca Fries were exceptionally unique and tasty, it is definitely worth a try.
author: Durif M.

description: This was a great meal experience-we pulled up to Sanguchon when it was parked in front of GoKart Racer in Burlingame. I only had $20 cash in my wallet but fortunately that was just enough for 2 sandwiches and 2 sodas. I got the pulled pork with coleslaw and potato chips inside. It was excellent, although it tasted more like something you'd get at a bbq joint than a peruvian food truck. Mr Q had the Lomo Saltado. I had serious sandwich envy. The meat melted in your mouth & had a great flavor. Ugh as I type this I wish I could get one of these sandwiches now. Mr Q raved about it for hours and even talked about tracking down the 2nd truck in Palo Alto for a repeat dinner performance. We'll definitely be trying these guys again!
author: Fancypants J.

description: This was delicious but before you go check their website! Drove to the address on yelp and sadly they were not there. Their website shows the weekly schedule where they will be set up. We found them on California street downtown. get the cookies!! yummy!!
author: Sunny S.

description: Criollo sandwich. Epic Fail. One ounce of chicken sandwiched between rice and potatoes. No mention of rice and potatoes on menu. $8 for a carb on carb on carb hot mess. I'm Peruvian and just about every Peruvian I know would have rejected this loser sandwich. Boo.
author: Steve H.

description: Made the mistake of trying this and was very dissatisfied with both the food and the  service. The lady taking orders today at the Saratoga ave location was extremely unpleasant. Unless you enjoy dry overpriced sandwiches and service with a bad attitude I would recommend passing on this food truck. To bad I'm forced to give them 1 star. Its more like -1
author: Hector O.

description: Pan con chicarron's pork definitely had good texture (slightly crunchy on outside and tender inside) but lacked flavor. Steak in Lomo Salta had good flavor. The 'special' bread was decent but not that special to me. I think the buns are too big for the amount of filling.
author: Agustinus T.

description: What happened here? I showed up with all the family and pulled some people in the line as we waited for our turn to order. It's Peruvian food!!!! Yum!!! But when we got to order the guy was very impolite, short tempered and in no mood to sell. We ordered pan con chicharron: the bread was hard, there was one boiled sweet potato as big as a quarter and the pig was so dry we had to get more sauce. I was disappointed and embarrassed to hear all the people that had ordered say it was as dry as paper. I give it one star because the food combined with the service deserves just that one star. A good pan con chicharron is good! Don't get confused. But today this guy should have taken a break if he was too tired to sell.
author: Paola L.

description:
After a letdown at HRD (they had run out of food the day before Thanksgiving), finding Sanguchon and eating their Pan con Chicharron lifted my hungry HRD-deprived spirits.  The bread was a little stale and the pork was a bit difficult to tear apart while eating the sandwich.  However, the fried yams and the overall flavors were good.

Don't forget a side of yucca fries too!
author: S L.

description: I'm beginning to find that each OTG truck I go to are pretty much on the expensive side.  But hey, that is why they are considered gourmet right? Anyways, I tried their Barbaccoa Pulled Pork Sandwich.  The meat was a bit chewy, tough, and the sweet sauce made it very messy to eat.  I also ordered the Yucca fries and it was pretty decent.  However paying $4 for 6 fries was a little daunting.  Even though each fry had a nice thickness to it, the qty just threw me off.  Despite my hangups I probably try again if there are no other options.  Another truck checked!
author: May B.

description: Had the beef burger with fries in it at the food cart event in upper Haight - loved it.
author: Steve D.

description: This food truck was parked a block away from my work last week, and I just happened to pass by during lunchtime.  There was a long line, so I decided to get on it as well. I ordered the lomo saltado sandwich for $8.  I thought that the flavor of the meat was decent, but I wish the onions had been cooked a little bit longer.  They gave a ton of red onions and they were basically raw.  It was different in that the lomo saltado was in the form of a sandwich, but other than that, it wasn't any better than other Peruvian places that I've had.
author: Tyler C.

description: had the barbacoa for lunch and the chips inside the sandwich made the perfect crunch for the perfect sandwich the bread was toasted to perfection and the sauce the meat was marinated was on point. definitely recommend it don't miss out on these delicious sandwiches
author: Antonio G.

description: A bomb a** chicken n tomatoes sammy was obliterated by my mouth.
author: Freckles H.

description:
One of my favorite food trucks! their Vegetales al Curry is one of the best wraps I've had, and I prefer it over the meat options. The Alfajores cookies are also great to have as well. 
Three stars because they almost always run out of the curry wrap when I go, and their locations are usually sporadic and not consistent aside from OTG :/
author: Aletta W.

description:
Solid 5 stars on this place.  Forgive my spelling.  Didn't feel like looking it up  

I've had the barbacoa (sandwich with potatoe chips in it) - This is just a great sandwich.  Very tasty.  Everyone in my office that tried it likes it.

Pan con chicharron - very tasty.  No one hasn't liked this sandwich.

Steak sandwich - forgot the name of this one but it was just ok compared to the other ones (against items in other trucks it would probably be considered good).

Vegetable curry burrito - Friggin awesome and I hate eating my veggies.  I'm a meat eater and finding something vegetarian that I would buy instead of a meat dish is really saying something.  It's got all kinds of vegetables good flavor and a little spicy sauce.  Very tasty.  You can take this home and heat it up later (just as good as when you get it fresh).  I don't heat it more than about 2-2.5 minutes.  Nobody has disliked this one.  

All in all I have tasted nothing bad on this truck.  Everything was worth the money and very tasty.
author: Mark T.

description: They were at the food truck crush event at larkspur on friday the 29th of july. I ordered the lomo saltado- steak sandwich and it was delicious.  It was diced steak with onions tomato and letteuce in an artisan sandwich roll. the bread was perfect. I also had the purple corn punch to drink and that was good. a little sweeter than expected. but again the sandwich was delicious. the sandwich was eight dollars and the drink was two dollars.
author: Matt D.

description:
I've tried Sanguchon twice now when they make it over to Pleasanton on Fridays recently.  

First time, I ordered the lomo saltado sandwich and an order of plantanos fritos.  The lomo saltado was very good, tender and juicy marinated strips of pan fried beef with a tangy mayonaise sauce, onions and yucca fries on a sturdy roll.  Very flavorful combination, and the yucca fries, while bland and not very crispy on their own, were good for soaking up the beef juices and sauce while eating.  

Second time, I ordered the pan con chicharron sandwich, roasted pork shoulder with mayo, onions and topped with few slices of fried sweet potato.  The shoulder was simply season but delicious, great combination of leaner, portions of pork with fatty and crispy pieces mixed throughout the sandwich, and played well with the sweetness of the sweet potato.  The bun was a little stale this time, though.  

Both times, I also ordered the planatos fritos, fried plantains with syrup and cinnamon, which were also very tasty and interesting.
author: Robert W.

description:
Lomo Saltido sandwich.

$8

Worth every penny---Damn Good! The bread was the highlight--perfectly toasted and crunchy.

Also grabbed some cookies ($4 for 2 cookies) to take home---damn good as well!!
author: Tim K.

description: One of my new favorite lunchtime spots! I'm determined to try everything on the menu, so far everything has exceeded my expectations! I really enjoyed their steak sandwich, the Lomo Saltado, and their fried plantains, Platano Frito. So delish!!
author: Inez T.

description: Delish!! Best sandwich I've had in a LONG time. The steak sandwich is the best. The meat is flavorful and tender, the bread is fresh and soft. LOVE this place!!!
author: lulu d.

description: Great truck, the lomo saltado sandwich is bomb.  So are the sweet potato fries that have awesome sauce and garnishes.  Food comes out fast.
author: Chris T.

description:
The Barbacoa sandwich was good, but a little small for $8.  My main complaint was the service.  There was a 20 minute line for this truck today at Civic Center.  I was OK with waiting b/c the menu looked great and it was a new addition to this OTG location.  But the person taking orders was very slow, and when I finally reached the window, she let me order and then informed me they were out of EVERYTHING except the Barbacoa sandwich and beef empanadas, despite the fact that it was only 1pm.  If I had known, I would not have waited for 20 minutes.  I asked if she could put up a "sold out" sign in the future.  She then started informing other people in the long, long line behind me that they were out of almost everything on the menu, and most of the customers left.

Short story--the food is good, but when you finally get a chance to order, you might find that they are sold out and didn't bother to tell anyone.
author: V W.

description: I tried the pork sandwich the yucca fries. The pork was not as tender as i expected and the yucca was not as warm. It seems like they were fried a number of hours ago and just kept warm.  I appreciated that there was sweet potato with the chicharon sandwich and onions. The effort for authenticity was there but the overall flavor and lasting impression was less impressive than I expected.
author: Cynthia G.

description: Lomo Saltado sandwich is the bomb for $8! It's about the size of a burger but it fills you up since it has fries in it. Try to get there before there's a long line. I'd say the total wait time is ten minutes from ordering to getting your food but might be longer if there are a ton of people ahead of you.
author: Tricia L.

description: Great flavors for decent prices. The Pan con Chicharon, Lomo Saltado, Aji de gallina, etc. it's all amazing! Their side dishes are very unique and delicious. My favorite are the yuca frita and their fried plantain. Such incredible combination of ingredients and flavor. I find them at Bishop Ranch in San Ramon. Will go every time they're in the East Bay!
author: V M.

description: Sanguchon, quite possibly the only "Food Truck" I'll ever be a customer of, don't get me wrong I love "taco trucks"...NOT!!!!! I despise them actually, maybe because I don't know, I value my life more than their $1 salmonella tacos, but Sanguchon takes care of your lunch needs on so many levels, not only the food is delicious, the management of the trucks takes care of  the returning customers, they have seen me so many times they know my name, the misconception is that they don't take CC's , (they do, over $10) My meal is pretty much always the same "Lomo Saltado" ($8), an Inca Kola ($2), and alfajores ($4)...for a whopping total of $14. The Lomo Saltado, a french bread bun, with sirloin steak, that is cooked wok-style with onions, tomatoes and fries (yes, you read right....fries) since it's the sandwich version of this traditional peruvian dish, they put lettuce, one sandwich will take care of your hunger needs....then Inca Kola, sounds weird but it's a "bubble gum flavor soda". It's owned by the Coca-Cola Company who bought it of it's original owners over a decade ago, and they have kept it a rather "bottom shelf soda" for obvious reason...many years ago Coca-Cola had the opportunity to buy Pepsi (before Pepsi was a global brand, but chose not to) Coca-Cola did not want to take the same risk with Inca Kola, try it...you will love it. The alfajores, which are two sweet biscuits joined with "dulce the leche".   They have a vegetarian wrap, and the "Pollo a la brasa" which is chicken sandwich. I have followed this truck to different cities during my lunch breaks... they are that good. I will remain a faithful patron of this truck.
author: Percy R.

description: 4.5 came for pan con chicharron.  great combo of flavors with a warm crisp bun (great tasting), light aioli with ricoto spread, nice (salsa criolla) red onions contrasted with fatty chunky pork and soft slices of fried sweet yam.  ok the main problem is that the pork pieces are too large thus hard to get a bite around the sandwich and all the contents spill out as you bite down.  Chef Altamirano -- good work with your growing empire.
author: Rob C.

description: Had the Aji de Gallina wrap (Chicken with rice/beans)  It was pretty creamy and tomato taste at the same time. The seasoning on it was good-- tasted like the peruvian dish you would get at the restaurant.. but wrapped up in a burrito.  I liked the fact that it was pretty huge and lasted me 2 meals!  The chicken was chicken breast so that was good too.  I also tried the Chica morada (corn punch).. this was way too sweet ! It tasted like syrup.  Had to dilute it with tons and tons of ice.  The best part of this truck is the the peruvian cookies.  I think they recently raised the price on these... they are delectable and to die for !  you only get two cookies... they are two shortbread cookies sandwiching rich dulce de leche gooey goodness topped with powdered sugar!  I ate one of these and it satisfied my sweet craving for the rest of the day!  They aren't cheap though.. $4 for 2 cookies but they tasted so fresh and soft they were probably made that day.
author: Margie C.

description: i am a fan of this places and i tell everyone about this place its so good ! i go to alameda when they are there sat 11-3 OMG this truck is sooooooOOooo good !!!once you try it you are hooked!! the meat is so tender well done the thin fries inside is just like the lomo saltado plate ! this is 5 stars all the way! if you havent gone its a must ! i always say food is like a heart beat cant live with out it and this a beat i sure cant miss !
author: Lizet P.

description: Sanguchon - a Peruvian food truck, sounded yummy, I'd been wanting to try it for a while. And.. I finally did. I had the purple corn juice ($2)..something I'd especially wanted to try. They make it themselves, and yes, it really is purple. It tastes of cloves, like a cold mulled apple cider, not made of apples. Really weird, but I liked it. I think having it once was enough for me, more of a novelty thing. I also had the pan con chicharron, which is on bread made just for this truck, pretty good bread, not anything special. I read that the pork was very lean, but it managed to be both dry and fatty at the same time. I even had a bite of just fat, which I had to spit out (fortunately, I was eating alone!). I did like the yucca, I think it was, that was in there, but there was only about a bite, it wasn't spread around enough. The sandwich is $8, but it's big, with a lot of meat, so I guess it's a good value. I feel like you have to be more of a meat eater for this..to me it was just dry, bland, kinda tasteless, except for the sauce, which still wasn't too tasteful. I rate this lunch an OK. Not bad, not awesome, not worth returning for me, but worth you checking out to see if you might like it better than me. I almost rated it meh 2 stars, but the drink was cool.
author: Merredith L.

description: It was around 11am on Friday morning when I received the call I had been waiting for...Time to sample some food truck cuisine! My good buddy and veteran yelp reviewer lead us to the first set of food trucks that I was going to experience for the day. I opted for the barbacoa pulled pork sandwich. When I finally heard my name called, I was presented with a sandwich overflowing with tender chunks of pork with just the right amount of barbecue sauce, both sweet and tangy. I was also able to sample a few pieces of the fried plantains with honey and cinnamon. I couldn't help but to try and scoop up the remaining honey and cinnamon at the bottom of the container. Good beginning to an afternoon of eating.
author: Mark Y.

description: Absolutely delicious! Loved the lomo saltado. I kept eating it even though I was completely stuffed. I was bummed the yucca fries were sold out but I'll have to try them next time. Make sure to get there early otherwise you'll be waiting awhile like I did.
author: Julie H.

description: I love to love food trucks but I will not be coming back to this one. Just ate here with my coworkers in the Portero. and it didn't turn out well. I had the chicken wrap, it didn't have much flavor the beans inside were not fully cooked. One coworker had the BBQ sandwich and had to pull out large chunks of chewy cartilage from every bite. Sweet potato fries were not awful, but were definitely the least tasty fries I've ever had. Only thing that made me happy was the plantains. Hoping I won't be feeling the wrath of this one later on tonight... sorry Sanguchon, I wanted to love you but it just wasn't a good fit.
author: Jayde C.

description: my husband like the vegi wrap...i ordered pork sandwich...hemmm...not that impressed. the bun was so hard and the pork...i wish they can slice it a bit smaller or thinner...will i order it again..probably not...but i will order the vegi wrap for my hubby :)
author: Pikachu P.

description: does anybody else feel like the bread they use for their steak sandwich is pretty much equivalent to eating a sourdough bread bowl from Boudin? the bread was so dense and heavy that it took away from any flavor that the meat had. oh, and please do yourself a favor and skip the plantains with honey and cinnamon. they're just dry and not worth wasting any calories on.
author: Regina C.

description: Tried the braised lamb taco at San Jose's Taco Festival - supposedly marinated in beer, but that wasn't really apparent.  It was however, tender, massive (with a hefty tortilla) with just the right amount of gaminess to remind you that you're eating lamb without being overpowering.
author: Jeremy C.

description: pork loin sandwich yum yum- bread is soft and meat is goood.  ajii chicken wrap.....umm no....pass....
author: Rob C.

description: The lomo saltado sandwich is heavenly. However, the price just brings down the whole experience.Its not as cheap as you would expect from a food truck. I would go back may be once a couple of months.
author: I Love Good Foo D.

description: Tried Sanguchon the past Saturday at Moveable Feast, Garden City mostly because everyone was raving about this truck.  Had their Pollo A La Brasa for $8.00.  The sandwich was ok, so-so.  After eating the sandwich though, I felt thirsty ALL day long, which means... a little too much MSG!  Hmm.
author: Oscar I.

description: I've been to a couple of the food trucks (Off the Grid) on Pine and they have all pleased. However, I love Peruvian food, specifically Lomo Saltado and I ordered the Lomo Saltado sandwich and it was soooo yummy!  I will definitely be back to try more.
author: Julia G.

description: I have been looking forward to trying one of this sandwiches, I had heard so many good things about the sandwiches. Last night when I was with my sister she saw a post on fb saying that they were in el Cerrito, I had gotten so happy cause they only showed up in sf, my sister had already eaten one and said it was good and that they accepted credit card, it was around 8:00 and the food truck closed at 9:00 we rushed to the food truck in our pj and slippers( lol ). When we got there, there was a lot of food trucks around. we finally reached the truck, me and my sister ordered the combo of pan con chicharron and it came with sweet potato fries, when my sister was going to pay they said that they weren't accepting credit card at the moment, We didn't have cash with us, luckily there was a bank around the corner. we finally got our sandwiches. when we opened them they were so big I would recommend to share half if your not so hungry. it was good and I would definitely come again however I think I will bring cash with me just incase. The reason my review isn't a 5 star is because well we didn't have cash with us, it would have been good to know that their credit card wasn't working at the moment, also the fact that the combo didn't come with a drink so buy a drink or bring your own. My experience was pretty good over all their sandwiches were good!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
author: Vale T.

description: I'm fortunate that his food truck was the first to be appointed with my employer's new initiative to bring in food trucks once a week otherwise I would've never tried Peruvian food. I ordered the chicken wrap ($8) because I wasn't in a sandwich mood and I was never fond of sandwiches being served on hamburge-bun-like rolls. I'm really glad that I did now that I've read the reviews complaining about the bun. The wrap was great! Very flavorful in the Peruvian way I suppose. It had just enough spiciness but not too much (I'm a low spice person). It had more carbs (potato, rice?) than meat. I would've preferred dark meat chicken myself but I know that's probably not what the masses want. On a whim I also decided to buy a pack of their Alfajores cookies--WOW! It was like eating a pastry, very delicate and definitely was hand made. It was very rich as well so I gave away the other one. I'd come back.
author: M Y.

description: I am a Cali-Peruvian, but I grew up in NorCal and have only visited Lima twice, most recently five years ago. I went to Larkspur, with wifey (from Mexico), eager to try it all. We missed out on drinks, but she ordered a pollo a la brasa sand and I had the lomo saltado. Mine was great, meat tender, good fries, tender but not soggy, and the bread was perfect. I needed more aji, more spice, but that could be my fault for not requesting it. Her sandwich was a bit less impressive, with a few gristly bits of chicken mixed in and super soft on seasoning of any kind. Our theory was that they might tone it down - seasoning that is - for the crowd, which would be an oversight, an underestimation, and a mistake, but who knows. I tasted it twice to see if I got a bland spot the first time, but it was forgettable. Not bad, but not great. The platanos fritos were really good for both of us, and we gobbled up the alfajores, although I am spoiled from having really good ones all the time growing up. I will return, and she will try something else.
author: R. M.

description: *really* good. really tasty, fresh, good spice level. the wraps are huge and filling, but happily so - you end up happily comatose and not grossly bloated.
author: Wangston P.
